result.execSummary:
The defendant Denaire Washington was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use Dangerous Weapon (Misdemeanor)], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to:  consecutive to count 2, with credit for 0 days time served.

miscConds.notes: AS TO EACH COUNT:  Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED. Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.

No contact with firearms.
48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
No new law violations.

Attend and successfully complete Anger Management and continued programming.
Parenting classes.
Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Denaire Washington

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Denaire Washington in court with attorney Susan Roth.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Denaire Washington in court with attorney Steven R. Kohn.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.
AS to count 2:   Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and the defendant.
The court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, with credit for 5 days time served. 
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
AS to count 1:    
The court sentenced the defendant to serve 210 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to count 2, with credit for 0 days time served. 
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months, concurrent.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION as to each count:
-Serve 30 days in the House of Correction (Consecutive) STAYED pending a review on 1-18-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.
-Attend and successfully complete  Anger Management and continued programming.
-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Parenting classes.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
-Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
-48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
RECEIVED & FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Denaire Washington in court with attorney Steven R. Kohn.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  As to both counts:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  Sentencing adjourned to 9-16-2015 at 1:15pm  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Defendant Denaire Washington in court with attorney Steven R. Kohn.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Final pre-trial scheduled for 08-11-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Denaire Washington in court with attorney Steven R. Kohn.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called in the p.m.
Defense counsel informs Court this is his first appearance as to this case.  Defense counsel offered explanation as to defendant's non-appearance for the hearing scheduled at 8:30 a.m.
Court admonishes defendant regarding being on time for court appearances and orders case adjourned for final pre-trial in Branch 4.
Court advises defendant that the bail conditions remain as previously set including the No Contact Order, no weapons, no violations of the law.
Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Denaire Washington in court.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney Steven Kohn appeared as a friend of the court (via telephonics).
Defendant requests an adjournment to retain counsel.  Attorney Kohn advised the court that he has a meeting set up today with defendant at 5:30 pm, but has not been officially retained as counsel.  Case adourned for Status Conference in Branch 4 on 6-30-2015 at 8:30 am. All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Chelsea S., Douglas J. and Kenny C., no weapons in possession and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.  Defendant must have counsel present on the next date, per the Court.  mld

Defendant Denaire Washington in court.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
 Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Scheduling Conference in Br.04.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 6/1/15 @ 1:30 pm
